result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. KNOX was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on 15 CF 72, to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search as directed by the agent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with the victim's family.

Have no contact with any known drug dealers or users.

Comply with electronic monitoring if approved/ordered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. KNOX

Settlement Conference Summary.   Settlement conference with District Attorney reset to 06-17-15 @ 3:45 p.m. Plea hearing is set for 07-02-15 @ 10:00 a.m. BR-3.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-24-15 at 4:00 p.m.   Plea date is set for 07-02-15 at 10:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 03-10-15.

At 2:54 p.m., $3,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and intimidate witness.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Laura Levendosky and Jason Kopidlansky.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
